column4: Hey guys... do-release-upgrade fails badly on a fresh installed edgy (using debootstrap on a domU)  using do-release-upgrade
I tried googling.. but couldn't find a bug entry about.. anybody knows a other update method??
are you trying to get to gutsy?
In the end I am trying to go to gutsy...
so its a server install of edgy, and you tried to upgrade?  even if it failed, wouldn't it now be gutsy, at least repository wise?
did you follow me on that one?

I use debootstrap from my dom0 to install edgu (we run edgy on dom0) to kick off a new domU... then we are planning to upgrade... this worked fine on already running domU's.. only on this fresh one it seems to fail
as we don't update dom0 to new release... we only do it on domU's

sorry mate, I don't know what dom0 and domU's are, so this may be out of my league.  BUT, I believe a manual install involves just changing your sources file, and changing all references of edgy to gutsy, then running sudo apt-get dist-upgrade a few times
we are running xen... we host a couple of virtual servers....
I will use that.... I always used it running debian.... I was just hoping to 'ubuntu' method would also work again
one more thing, you may have to upgrade to feisty, and then to gutsy
will do that in two steps.... will let you know how it goes
: from feisty to gutsy i can use do-release-upgrade again... huraaay
actually...looks like it... my server is 9.000KM away... so I cannot hear it :)
it may be in the repos, but I don't think its installed by default.  Not even the JRE is default installed
